Summary: Group of friends and I stayed here earlier this month for a wedding in the area. First red flag is that you have to call for a room. Like someone else mentioned, I cried when we first got there. Depressing place. Felt weird dressing up for the wedding then walking through the complex. Weirdos living there with their doors wide open and their mess all around will stare at you any time of day. Did not feel comfortable sleeping under the covers or using any of their water. I did muster up the courage to brush my teeth, though. This place is just depressing.

I want to thank the owner Song for making my stay enjoyable. We did a remodel & needed a place to stay for a few months. The staff is friendly & helpful. Close to stores and beach with good price for suites in the beach area. So if visiting Huntington Beach and need a clean place with kitchen(can get supplies just ask) pool and close to the beach this is the place for you. The best price in town.....Many thanks.....Betty
Room tip: Choose a room on 2nd floor facing side street

Summary Heading: Better than most dumpy motels, but still a dump
Summary: I'm staying here over the Christmas holidays, which makes the holidays even more depressing.  Walking around the place reeks of cigarette smoke from all the low-life staying here. The place seems really old, although the rooms are decent... fair size, nice enough kitchen (but no supplies...pots, pans, silverware). Walls are thin, which is a drag when they rent the adjacent room to 4 drunk lowlife that are up laughing and partying past 3:30 AM... and I could hear every word. Also, they told me that if you are staying for the week (which I did to get a decent rate) they told me that room service is provided 1xweek... which translates to no room cleaning.  In any case, this is not a holiday destination, so if you're on vacation, don't waste your time here... you would cry when you
Room tip: Total crap shoot, and will depend on who you get in the adjacent room(s)

Summary: Well.... You get a spacy room with a kitchen and a huge bathroom for a $100 a night. That's ok.  What could be better is the service: it should clean the kitchen and change the linen more often.  The pOol is sutuated next to the street.. But there is a pool!  Would be great if they would provIDE more kitchen stuff than just a pan an cutlery.  Overall we liked it and stayed longer than planned.

Ok so I've read the reviews on the place and a lot of people have said that it's clean and with new furniture etc.  That is definitely not the case, the bedspreads have blood stains on them, the blankets have cigarette holes in them (even though we stayed in a non-smoking room).  The place does not represent the photos on the website at all - it's a complete front.  It is not worth the price paid it is worse then a backpackers - you can hear people upstairs (doing something adults do late at night) constantly.  Not worth coming here - pay a little extra and go elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by their website - more like the bates motel
Summary: I booked online. I believed the photos, the words. Don't. It's miles from the beach and looks like it rents rooms by the hour. Enough said,

Huntington Suites was recommended by a friend who has stayed there many times. It doesn't look like the Ritz but then it doesn't try to be anything it's not. The rooms are nice, spacious as a studio apartment, and clean with fresh matresses and furniture. Each unit has a kitchenette, DirectTV, free internet, and lots of hot water. There's a sparkling clean swimming pool, on-premises laundramat, and plenty of safe parking. There are a variety of stores, restaurants, and a friendly neighborhood bar right across the street. The biggest surprise is the sincerely caring owner (Ms. Song) who makes it a point of keeping you happy enough to come back another time. When ever I go to Huntington Beach this place is home sweet home!

Summary Heading: Good Value for Location-clean, quiet no-frills motel
Summary: Clean quiet motel with kitchens approx 2 miles from beach with stores within  walking distance including 24 hour Walgreen; approx 2 miles  to beach -you can ride the bus to or drive; no frills motel  pool very nice; wireless internet access; rooms are very clean -no high priced pampering but while traveling if you are tired of eating out can prepare a meal in your room and save money too.  Comes with basic cable and midsized fridge; staff and owner very nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great Motel for the Budget Minded Traveler
Summary: This motel was a real find. We were looking for a spacious room near the ocean, in a safe neighborhood. And we wanted a kitchen. This place was just perfect for us. We rented a one bedroom suite, $100 night but we got a week for $500 (a real deal). The Huntington Beach area is really nice and quiet and has a very low crime rate. This was a concern for me as my son would be with me. The one bedroom suite is spacious. There is a full kitchen including a microwave. This saved us a bundle over eating out. I do have to note; however, that it would have been better if they supplied pots, pans, disher, etc. They do not so we picked a few things up at the grocery store. We forgot a few things, but there is a 24 hour Walgreens right across the street. Albertson's Groceries is one block
Confortable, good price, we went with our children last year, near to the supermarkets, to the beach, the owner was very gentle, and the cleaning very good, we will go this year again.

Summary Heading: Too Hot, AC does NOT work, Pool closed by 6 pm. Hated IT
Summary: Had 1 bedroom. No Air Conditioning in the bedroom and very hot so I couldn't sleep. Air Conditioner in living room barely cools and it's older than mud. Too hot, put on bathing suit and went out to pool. The pool area was already locked at 6 p.m.! No listed times. The manager just locks up at any time she wants to.  Next time I'll stay at the Best Western down the street!

I've been going to Huntington Beach for the last few years and I stumbled upon this place a few years back.  All of the rooms are suites and have full kitchen and dining areas.  They have weekly rates that are much cheaper than nightly (there or anywhere else) so you end up saving money on accom as well as eating in.  The hotel is older, but kept clean.  The owners did some upgrades last year (painting, carpeting, etc.) and added wireless internet, so my stay in Aug was even better.  About a mile from Main St, so i'll walk in (15 - 20 min) and get a cab back.  Could be closer, but probably explains the reasonable rates, other then that, clean and quiet.
